body:
Hey all. I've been working on my own decimal library for a little while and it's mostly completed.

It's a "big" decimal type -- not decimal32, 64, 128, etc.

My current goals are:

1. Finish comprehensive test suite (and iron out any bugs that pop up)
2. Add proper support for scientific notation strings
3. Figure out how I want to support NaN/Inf (currently panics but since it's a "big" decimal that's hard to do) in a nice way
4. Minor optimizations (some parts are a bit naive)

Please feel free to rip it apart (or contribute) if you'd like. I'm a bit biased, but I believe it's a more proper library than some of the others out there. (Don't get me wrong -- I'm not knocking theirs, but the ones I've seen have to convert decimals to strings and parse the strings to do division or use cgo.)

https://github.com/EricLagergren/decimal
